page.title: 03Shanklin Chine
page.content: {Shanklin Chine is an area of natural {beauty.}A swiftly flowing stream runs through a sandstone gorge, breaking at intervals over waterfalls. It is a haven for wild life of many different kinds, where children can study plants and animals in their natural surroundings of woodland and river. { {Shanklin Chine }was first opened to the public on 1817 and has since given pleasure to millions. It was part of the {Manor of Shanklin}the lordship of which has been in the hands of the Popham Family since 1907.{Chine}is a local word and now used only in the Isle of Wight and Dorset. It is of Saxon origin and means a deep narrow ravine, formed by water cutting through soft sand stone leading to the sea.
